content.question: Given the graph of the short-run aggregate supply <math alttext=" S R A S " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>SRAS</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and long-run aggregate supply <math alttext="L R A S " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>LRAS</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> curves above, which of the following is true?

choices.label: At point Z, the economy has cyclical unemployment.
At point Z, the economy is in long-run equilibrium but not in short-run equilibrium.
At point Y, the natural rate of unemployment is zero.
At point X, the economy is experiencing a recessionary gap.
At point X, there is no frictional unemployment.

content.answer: At point X, the economy is experiencing a recessionary gap.

topic.text: 3.5: Equilibrium in the Aggregate Demand-Aggregate Supply (AD-AS) Model

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
